Hello,

has anyone realized that bug, yet?

It appears in Matlab and Python=
.

Here the example files.

Matlab:
---------------------------
clear;
Druc=
k=3D50E5;
Temperatur=3D520+273.15;
Zusammensetzung=3D'CH4:1,H2O:1,O2:0.55';=

g =3D GRI30;
set(g,'T',Temperatur,'P',Druck,'X',Zusammensetzung);

%should=
 be zero:
a=3Dnetprodrates(g)-(creationrates(g)-destructionrates(g))

%but =
when you call:
K=3Dequil_Kc(g);

% b differs from a 
b=3Dnetprodrates(g)-(c=
reationrates(g)-destructionrates(g))


---------------------------

Python:=

---------------------------
from Cantera import *
g =3D GRI30()
g.set(T =
=3D 520+273.15, P =3D 50E5, X =3D 'CH4:1,H2O:1,O2:0.55')
a=3Dg.netProductio=
nRates()-(g.creationRates()-g.destructionRates())

K=3Dg.equilibriumConstan=
ts()

b=3Dg.netProductionRates()-(g.creationRates()-g.destructionRates())

=
#a and b should be equal!
---------------------------

Does anyone have an =
explanation?

Another question:

is there a possibility (for Matlab) to get=
 the rate coefficients
k_i(T) of every reaction i? 

Thank you very much. R=
egards Markus Rehm.
